intro: Moniera floribunda, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves and showy inflorescences that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
